revision.text: ==Wauja== {{wikipedia|Jaguar}} [[Image: Obscured jaguar.jpg|thumb|right|Jaguar, Belize, 2001. Photo: Gary M. Stoltz.]] [[Image: Black Panther by Bruce McAdam.jpg|thumb|right|Black or melanistic jaguar, 2008, often called black panther, though the spotted and black forms are one species. Photo: Bruce McAdam.]] ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|wau|/ˌja.nuˈma.ka/}} ===Noun=== {{head|wau|noun}} # jaguar, jaguars, ''[[Panthera onca]]'', symbol of a chief in Wauja culture ====Derived terms==== * {{l|wau|yanumaka kapala}} {{qualifier|spotted}} * {{l|wau|yanumaka yelaki}} {{qualifier|black or melanistic}} ====See also==== * {{l|wau|outala}} (cougar) ====References==== * ''E. Ireland field notes, confirmed with Piitsa, Muri, and other elders (all experienced hunters) in 1982 using José Cândido de Melo Carvalho's Atlas da Fauna Brasileira, Edições Melhoramentos, São Paulo, 1981.'' [[Category:wau:Animals]] [[Category:wau:Felids]] [[Category:wau:Mammals]]
